content:
```
Brave New World
Chapter 1
Page 3

But there was no need to worry about anything as long as one obeyed the rules of the game. The rules were simple, few, and flexible, and the penalties for breaking them were extremely harsh. The most important rule was: No one was allowed to be unhappy.

"Of course not," the Director of Hatcheries and Conditioning said, when Lenina Crowne had protested. "What do you think we are? Civilized?"

The World State had no use for individuals who didn't know how to be happy, who were unhappy for no good reason. There were special schools where they taught you how to be happy, how to be a good Alpha or Beta or Gamma or Delta or Epsilon, how to be a good member of the society in which you lived.

"But how do they make the babies?" asked Lenina.

The Director of Hatcheries and Conditioning looked surprised. "In the factory, of course," he said.
```
